title: Intimacy & Confidence Playbook
subtitle: Blend behavioural micro-habits with medical support for erections, arousal, and connection.
summary: We see couples weekly who feel disconnected because of ED, low desire, or pelvic floor changes. This guide shows how to audit relationship dynamics, create low-pressure rituals, and understand when to add clinical treatments like P-Shot®, shockwave therapy, or hormonal optimisation.

sections.title: Rebuild intimacy outside the bedroom
sections.intro: Pressure-free contact resets your nervous system before any medical therapy.

items.heading: Micro-connection habits
items.body: Schedule 10-minute phone-free walks, gratitude swaps, or shared breathing before bed. These rituals stimulate oxytocin and reduce the performance loop.

items.heading: Communication scripts
items.body: Use the 'What I feel / What I need / How you can help' format to discuss desire or anxiety. It keeps feedback specific without blame.

items.heading: Nervous system priming
items.body: Slow exhales (4-7-8 breathing) or guided pelvic floor relaxation lowers sympathetic tone, making arousal signals easier to reach.

sections.title: Lifestyle factors that sabotage intimacy
sections.intro: Most ED cases have a metabolic or pelvic component we can optimise.

items.heading: Sleep + alcohol
items.body: Aim for 7–8 hours of sleep and limit alcohol to <7 units weekly. REM sleep drives testosterone and dopamine pathways that fuel desire.

items.heading: Pelvic floor and circulation
items.body: Alternate strength training with LISS cardio, plus pelvic floor physiotherapy if you notice urinary leaks or difficulty maintaining erections.

items.heading: Medication review
items.body: SSRIs, beta-blockers, and 5-alpha inhibitors can blunt arousal. Bring your prescription list so we can coordinate with your GP.

sections.title: Medical options that restore confidence
sections.intro: When lifestyle work still leaves gaps, regenerative therapies deliver measurable improvements.

items.heading: P-Shot®
items.body: Concentrated platelet-rich plasma thickens the corpus cavernosum, improves sensitivity, and can add 10–20% girth. Results develop over 6–12 weeks.

items.heading: Shockwave Therapy
items.body: Six sessions of focused acoustic waves rebuild micro-vascular networks and boost natural erections without pills.

items.heading: Hormonal + peptide support
items.body: For low testosterone or post-menopausal changes we coordinate with endocrinology partners, often layering BHRT, kisspeptin, or PT-141 with counselling.

faqs.question: Can I combine counselling with medical treatments?
faqs.answer: Absolutely. We collaborate with sex therapists so behavioural rewiring and regenerative medicine reinforce each other.

faqs.question: How soon will I see results after shockwave therapy?
faqs.answer: Most patients notice fuller morning erections by session four, with peak results 8–12 weeks after completing the series.

faqs.question: Is the P-Shot painful?
faqs.answer: We use numbing cream plus vibration analgesia. Patients report minimal discomfort and can resume daily activities immediately.
